batch_interactions.request:
Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /auth resource.

Application Context: A Student Attendance Management System that allows students to mark their daily attendance 
and teachers to view and manage attendance records. The system includes user authentication 
with separate roles for students and teachers, profile management, and password recovery features.
Students can log in to mark their attendance daily, while teachers can view attendance records 
and track student attendance patterns. The system provides a clean, intuitive interface for 
both user types.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: login
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/login
   Description: Authenticate user credentials
   Used by pages: Login Page
2. Endpoint: forgot_password
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/forgot-password
   Description: Send password reset link to user
   Used by pages: Login Page
3. Endpoint: register
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/register
   Description: Create new user account
   Used by pages: Login Page
4. Endpoint: validate_username
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/auth/validate-username
   Description: Check if username is available
   Used by pages: Login Page
5. Endpoint: validate_password
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/validate-password
   Description: Check if password meets requirements
   Used by pages: Login Page
6. Endpoint: get_user_role
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/auth/user-role
   Description: Retrieve user role
   Used by pages: Login Page
7. Endpoint: login_attempt
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/login-attempt
   Description: Track login attempts and enforce login failure limit and timeout
   Used by pages: Login Page
8. Endpoint: Authenticate Teacher
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/teacher/login
   Description: Authenticate teacher and authorize access to student information
   Used by pages: Student Information

Return a JSON array with specifications for each endpoint in order:
[
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 1", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 1"},
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 2", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 2"},
  ...
]

JSON array only:

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /attendance resource.

Application Context: A Student Attendance Management System that allows students to mark their daily attendance 
and teachers to view and manage attendance records. The system includes user authentication 
with separate roles for students and teachers, profile management, and password recovery features.
Students can log in to mark their attendance daily, while teachers can view attendance records 
and track student attendance patterns. The system provides a clean, intuitive interface for 
both user types.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Mark Attendance
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/attendance/mark
   Description: Mark attendance for a student
   Used by pages: Dashboard, Attendance Marking
2. Endpoint: Get Attendance Records
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/records
   Description: Retrieve attendance records for a teacher
   Used by pages: Dashboard
3. Endpoint: Get Attendance History
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/history
   Description: Retrieve attendance history for a student or class
   Used by pages: Dashboard, Attendance Marking
4. Endpoint: Get Attendance Patterns
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/patterns
   Description: Retrieve attendance patterns for a student or class
   Used by pages: Dashboard, Attendance Analytics
5. Endpoint: Filter Attendance Records
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/records/filter
   Description: Filter attendance records by date, student, or class
   Used by pages: Dashboard
6. Endpoint: Get Attendance Statistics
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/statistics
   Description: Retrieve attendance statistics
   Used by pages: Dashboard, Attendance Analytics
7. Endpoint: Search Attendance Records
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/records/search
   Description: Search attendance records for a specific student
   Used by pages: Dashboard
8. Endpoint: Get Attendance Calendar
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/calendar
   Description: Fetch calendar data for attendance marking
   Used by pages: Attendance Marking
9. Endpoint: Add Attendance Comment
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/attendance/comment
   Description: Add comments or reasons for absence
   Used by pages: Attendance Marking
10. Endpoint: Check Attendance Status
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/status
   Description: Check if attendance is already marked for the day
   Used by pages: Attendance Marking
11. Endpoint: Validate Attendance Time Frame
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/timeframe
   Description: Check if attendance marking is within the allowed time frame
   Used by pages: Attendance Marking
12. Endpoint: Get Student Attendance Records
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/records/:studentId
   Description: Retrieve attendance records for an individual student
   Used by pages: Attendance Analytics
13. Endpoint: Get Class Attendance Statistics
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/class-statistics
   Description: Retrieve overall class attendance statistics
   Used by pages: Attendance Analytics
14. Endpoint: Get Attendance Data
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/data
   Description: Retrieve attendance data with filters and sorting
   Used by pages: Attendance Analytics
15. Endpoint: Get Attendance Visualization Data
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/visualization-data
   Description: Retrieve data for visualizing attendance patterns
   Used by pages: Attendance Analytics
16. Endpoint: Get Student Attendance Percentage
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/attendance/percentage/:studentId
   Description: Retrieve attendance percentage for an individual student
   Used by pages: Attendance Analytics

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /password-recovery resource.

Application Context: A Student Attendance Management System that allows students to mark their daily attendance 
and teachers to view and manage attendance records. The system includes user authentication 
with separate roles for students and teachers, profile management, and password recovery features.
Students can log in to mark their attendance daily, while teachers can view attendance records 
and track student attendance patterns. The system provides a clean, intuitive interface for 
both user types.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Send Password Recovery Email
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/password-recovery/send-email
   Description: Sends a password recovery email to the user
   Used by pages: Password Recovery
2. Endpoint: Validate Username or Email
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/password-recovery/validate-credentials
   Description: Validates if the username or email address exists in the database
   Used by pages: Password Recovery
3. Endpoint: Resend Password Recovery Email
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/password-recovery/resend-email
   Description: Resends the password recovery email if the user does not receive it
   Used by pages: Password Recovery
4. Endpoint: Reset Password
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/password-recovery/reset-password
   Description: Resets the user's password
   Used by pages: Password Recovery
5. Endpoint: Verify Password Recovery Token
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/password-recovery/verify-token
   Description: Verifies the password recovery token sent in the email
   Used by pages: Password Recovery

JSON array only:

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /students resource.

Application Context: A Student Attendance Management System that allows students to mark their daily attendance 
and teachers to view and manage attendance records. The system includes user authentication 
with separate roles for students and teachers, profile management, and password recovery features.
Students can log in to mark their attendance daily, while teachers can view attendance records 
and track student attendance patterns. The system provides a clean, intuitive interface for 
both user types.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get All Students
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students
   Description: Retrieve a list of all students
   Used by pages: Attendance Records
2. Endpoint: Get Student Attendance Records
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/attendance
   Description: Retrieve attendance records for a specific student
   Used by pages: Attendance Records, Student Information
3. Endpoint: Filter Attendance Records By Date Range
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/attendance?startDate={startDate}&endDate={endDate}
   Description: Retrieve attendance records for a specific date range
   Used by pages: Attendance Records
4. Endpoint: Search Students
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/search?q={query}
   Description: Search for specific students by name or ID
   Used by pages: Attendance Records
5. Endpoint: Get Detailed Attendance History
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/attendance/history
   Description: Retrieve detailed attendance history for a specific student
   Used by pages: Attendance Records, Attendance History, Student Information
6. Endpoint: Export Attendance Records To CSV
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/attendance/export/csv
   Description: Export attendance records to CSV
   Used by pages: Attendance Records
7. Endpoint: Export Attendance Records To Excel
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/attendance/export/excel
   Description: Export attendance records to Excel
   Used by pages: Attendance Records
8. Endpoint: Get Student Profile
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/profile
   Description: Retrieve student's profile information
   Used by pages: Attendance History, Student Information
9. Endpoint: Get Attendance History By Date Range
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/attendance/history/byDateRange
   Description: Retrieve student's attendance history for a specific date range
   Used by pages: Attendance History
10. Endpoint: Search Attendance Records
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/attendance/history/search
   Description: Search for specific attendance records
   Used by pages: Attendance History
11. Endpoint: Export Attendance History
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/attendance/history/export
   Description: Export student's attendance history in CSV or PDF format
   Used by pages: Attendance History
12. Endpoint: Get Attendance Summary
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/attendance/summary
   Description: Retrieve student's attendance summary (total days present, absent, percentage)
   Used by pages: Attendance History
13. Endpoint: Search Students
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/search
   Description: Search for students by name
   Used by pages: Attendance Analytics, Student Information
14. Endpoint: Filter Students
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/filter
   Description: Filter students by class or attendance status
   Used by pages: Student Information
15. Endpoint: Get Student Dashboard
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/dashboard
   Description: Retrieve dashboard view for teachers to overview student attendance
   Used by pages: Student Information
16. Endpoint: Get Student Profile Picture
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/profile-picture
   Description: Retrieve student profile picture
   Used by pages: Student Information
17. Endpoint: Get Student Contact Information
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/contact-info
   Description: Retrieve student contact information
   Used by pages: Student Information
18. Endpoint: Get Detailed Attendance Records
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/students/{studentId}/attendance/details
   Description: Retrieve detailed attendance records for a student
   Used by pages: Student Information

Application Context: A Student Attendance Management System that allows students to mark their daily attendance 
and teachers to view and manage attendance records. The system includes user authentication 
with separate roles for students and teachers, profile management, and password recovery features.
Students can log in to mark their attendance daily, while teachers can view attendance records 
and track student attendance patterns. The system provides a clean, intuitive interface for 
both user types.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get User Profile
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/user-profile
   Description: Retrieve user profile information
   Used by pages: Settings
2. Endpoint: Update User Profile
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/user-profile
   Description: Update user profile information
   Used by pages: Settings
3. Endpoint: Change Password
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/user-profile/password
   Description: Change user password
   Used by pages: Settings

Return a JSON array with specifications for each endpoint in order:
[
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 1", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 1"},
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 2", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 2"},
  ...
]

Application Context: A Student Attendance Management System that allows students to mark their daily attendance 
and teachers to view and manage attendance records. The system includes user authentication

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get User Roles and Permissions
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/user-roles
   Description: Retrieve user roles and permissions
   Used by pages: Settings, User Roles Management
2. Endpoint: Update User Roles and Permissions
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/user-roles
   Description: Update user roles and permissions
   Used by pages: Settings
3. Endpoint: Create New User Role
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/user-roles
   Description: Allow administrators to add new user roles
   Used by pages: User Roles Management
4. Endpoint: Get User Role By ID
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/user-roles/{roleId}
   Description: Retrieve a specific user role by ID for editing
   Used by pages: User Roles Management
5. Endpoint: Update User Role
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/user-roles/{roleId}
   Description: Allow administrators to edit existing user roles
   Used by pages: User Roles Management
6. Endpoint: Delete User Role
   Method: DELETE
   Path: /api/user-roles/{roleId}
   Description: Allow administrators to delete existing user roles
   Used by pages: User Roles Management
7. Endpoint: Get Paginated User Roles
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/user-roles/paginated
   Description: Implement pagination for large lists of user roles
   Used by pages: User Roles Management

   Method: GET
   Path: /api/users/by-role/{roleId}
   Description: Allow administrators to filter users by role
   Used by pages: User Roles Management
6. Endpoint: Get Sorted Users
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/users/sorted
   Description: Allow administrators to sort users by name, role, or other relevant criteria
   Used by pages: User Roles Management

JSON array only:

endpoints.description: Authenticate user credentials
Send password reset link to user

response.message: string, password reset link sent successfully or error message

endpoints.description: Create new user account

response.message: string, user created successfully or error message

endpoints.description: Check if username is available

response.available: boolean, true if username is available, false otherwise

endpoints.description: Check if password meets requirements

response.valid: boolean, true if password meets requirements, false otherwise
response.message: string, password validation message

endpoints.description: Retrieve user role
Track login attempts and enforce login failure limit and timeout

response.locked: boolean, true if account is locked due to excessive login attempts, false otherwise
response.message: string, login attempt message

endpoints.description: Handles user registration

request_body.username: string, required, unique username chosen by the user
request_body.email: string, required, unique email address of the user
request_body.password: string, required, password for the user account
request_body.role: string, required, either 'student' or 'teacher' to determine user role
request_body.name: string, required, full name of the user

response.token: string, JWT token for authenticated user

user.username: string, username chosen by the user
user.email: string, email address of the user

endpoints.description: Checks if an email is already in use
endpoints.request_body: The request body should contain a JSON object with a single property 'email' which is the email to be validated. Example: {"email": "example@example.com"}
endpoints.response: The response will be a JSON object with a boolean property 'isAvailable' indicating whether the email is available or not, and a string property 'message' with a descriptive message. Example: {"isAvailable": true, "message": "Email is available"} or {"isAvailable": false, "message": "Email is already in use"}

endpoints.description: Checks if a username is already in use
endpoints.request_body: The endpoint accepts a query parameter 'username' which is the username to be validated. For example: GET /api/validate-username?username=johndoe
endpoints.response: The endpoint returns a JSON object with a boolean property 'isAvailable' indicating whether the username is available or not. For example: { 'isAvailable': true } or { 'isAvailable': false }

endpoints.description: Retrieves available roles for registration
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required
endpoints.response: JSON array of role objects, each containing 'id' and 'name' properties, e.g. [{"id": 1, "name": "Student"}, {"id": 2, "name": "Teacher"}]

endpoints.description: Retrieves terms and conditions for registration
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required for this endpoint

data.terms_and_conditions: string, contains the terms and conditions for registration

endpoints.description: Evaluates the strength of a given password

request_body.password: string (required) - the password to be evaluated

response.strength: string (required) - the strength of the password (e.g. weak, medium, strong)
response.score: integer (required) - a numerical score representing the password strength (e.g. 0-100)
response.feedback: array of strings (optional) - suggestions for improving the password strength

endpoints.description: Retrieve user's role and name
endpoints.request_body: No request body required. Authentication token must be provided in the headers for authorization.
endpoints.response: JSON object containing user's role and name, e.g., {"role": "student" or "teacher", "name": "John Doe"}

endpoints.description: Mark attendance for a student

response.message: string, describing the outcome of the request

endpoints.description: Retrieve attendance records for a teacher
Retrieve attendance history for a student or class
Retrieve attendance patterns for a student or class
Retrieve navigation menu items
endpoints.request_body: No request body required. Query parameters: none
endpoints.response: JSON array of navigation menu items. Each item contains: id (integer), name (string), url (string), icon (string), roles (array of strings), parentId (integer), order (integer)

endpoints.description: Retrieve calendar data
endpoints.request_body: No request body required. Query parameters: start_date (string, format: YYYY-MM-DD), end_date (string, format: YYYY-MM-DD), Optional: student_id (integer) if teacher wants to view specific student's calendar
endpoints.response: JSON object containing calendar data: { 'dates': [array of date strings in YYYY-MM-DD format], 'attendance_records': [array of objects with student_id, date, attendance_status (present/absent)] }

endpoints.description: Filter attendance records by date, student, or class
Retrieve notifications for a teacher
endpoints.request_body: No request body required. Authentication token must be provided in the Authorization header.
endpoints.response: A JSON array of notification objects. Each object contains the following properties: id (unique identifier), title, message, timestamp (date and time the notification was created), and read (boolean indicating whether the notification has been read). Example: [{id: 1, title: 'New Attendance Record', message: 'A new attendance record has been submitted.', timestamp: '2024-09-16T10:00:00.000Z', read: false}]

endpoints.description: Retrieve attendance statistics
Search attendance records for a specific student
Retrieve user profile information
endpoints.request_body: No request body required. Authentication token must be provided in the Authorization header.

endpoints.description: Update user profile details
Upload a new profile picture
endpoints.request_body: multipart/form-data with a 'picture' field containing the profile picture file

structure.picture_url: string (URL of the uploaded profile picture)

endpoints.description: Change user password
Validate user input for profile updates
Sends a password recovery email to the user

request_body.username_or_email: string (required) - The username or email address of the user
request_body.client_url: string (required) - The URL of the client application to redirect the user after password recovery

response.success: boolean (required) - Indicates whether the password recovery email was sent successfully
response.message: string (optional) - A message describing the result of the operation

endpoints.description: Validates if the username or email address exists in the database

request_body.username_or_email: string (required) - The username or email address to validate

response.valid: boolean (required) - Indicates whether the username or email address exists in the database
response.message: string (optional) - A message describing the result of the operation

endpoints.description: Resends the password recovery email if the user does not receive it

request_body.username_or_email: string (required) - The username or email address of the user
request_body.client_url: string (required) - The URL of the client application to redirect the user after password recovery

response.success: boolean (required) - Indicates whether the password recovery email was resent successfully
response.message: string (optional) - A message describing the result of the operation

endpoints.description: Resets the user's password

request_body.new_password: string (required) - The new password for the user
request_body.confirm_password: string (required) - The confirmation of the new password

response.success: boolean (required) - Indicates whether the password was reset successfully
response.message: string (optional) - A message describing the result of the operation

endpoints.description: Verifies the password recovery token sent in the email
endpoints.request_body: N/A

response.valid: boolean (required) - Indicates whether the password recovery token is valid
response.message: string (optional) - A message describing the result of the operation
response.user_id: integer (optional) - The ID of the user associated with the token

endpoints.description: Retrieve student details to confirm identity
endpoints.request_body: No request body required. Authentication token must be provided in the Authorization header.

response.description: Returns student details in JSON format

endpoints.description: Fetch calendar data for attendance marking
Add comments or reasons for absence

response.message: string, describing the outcome of the request

endpoints.description: Check if attendance is already marked for the day

response.attendance_status: boolean, indicating if attendance is already marked

endpoints.description: Check if attendance marking is within the allowed time frame

response.is_within_timeframe: boolean, indicating if attendance marking is within the allowed time frame

endpoints.description: Validate user authentication to ensure only authorized students can mark their attendance
endpoints.request_body: The request body for this endpoint should contain the student's username and password in JSON format, e.g., {"username": "student123", "password": "password123"}.
endpoints.response: The response will be a JSON object containing a token for authenticated students, e.g., {"token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIxMjM0NTY3ODkwIiwibmFtZSI6IkpvaG4gRG9lIiwiaWF0IjoxNTE2MjM5MDIyfQ.SflKxwRJSMeKKF2QT4fwpMeJf36POk6yJV_adQssw5c", "role": "student"}. If authentication fails, it will return a JSON object with an error message, e.g., {"error": "Invalid username or password"}.

menu_items.role: string, role required to access the menu item (e.g. student, teacher)

endpoints.description: Retrieve system default settings
endpoints.request_body: None, this endpoint does not require a request body

endpoints.description: Update system default settings

response.message: System defaults updated successfully

endpoints.description: Reset settings to default values
endpoints.request_body: No request body required. Resets all settings to default values.
endpoints.response: JSON object with success message: { 'message': 'Settings reset to default values' }

endpoints.description: Save settings changes
endpoints.request_body: JSON object with updated settings: { 'settings': [ { 'key': string, 'value': string } ] }. Example: { 'settings': [ { 'key': 'attendance', 'value': 'daily' } ] }
endpoints.response: JSON object with success message: { 'message': 'Settings updated successfully' }

endpoints.description: Validate settings changes
endpoints.request_body: JSON object with updated settings: { 'settings': [ { 'key': string, 'value': string } ] }. Example: { 'settings': [ { 'key': 'attendance', 'value': 'daily' } ] }
endpoints.response: JSON object with validation result: { 'valid': boolean, 'errors': [ { 'key': string, 'message': string } ] }

endpoints.description: Initiate password recovery process by sending a recovery email to the user's registered email address

request_body.email: string (required) - the email address of the user who wants to recover their password

response.message: string - a message indicating whether the password recovery email was sent successfully
response.data: object (optional) - additional data, such as a recovery token

endpoints.description: Validate user input to ensure it matches the username or email in the system

request_body.username_or_email: string (required) - the username or email to validate

response.status: boolean (required) - whether the credentials are valid
response.message: string (optional) - error message if credentials are invalid
response.user_id: integer (optional) - the ID of the user if credentials are valid

endpoints.description: Send a password recovery email to the user's registered email address

request_body.email: The email address of the user who forgot their password (string, required)

response.status: The status of the request (string, e.g. 'success' or 'error')
response.message: A message describing the outcome of the request (string, e.g. 'Recovery email sent successfully' or 'User not found')
response.data: Optional data returned with the response, e.g. a token or a link (object or null)

endpoints.description: Check if the username or email exists in the system
endpoints.request_body: The GET request should include two query parameters: 'username' and 'email'. The 'username' parameter checks if the username is available, and the 'email' parameter checks if the email is available. Both parameters are optional, but at least one of them should be provided.
endpoints.response: The response will be a JSON object with two properties: 'usernameAvailable' and 'emailAvailable'. The 'usernameAvailable' property will be a boolean indicating whether the username is available, and the 'emailAvailable' property will be a boolean indicating whether the email is available. If the 'username' or 'email' parameter is not provided, the corresponding property in the response will be null.

Retrieve the link to the homepage

endpoints.response: JSON object containing a single property 'homepageLink' with a string value representing the URL of the homepage, e.g. { 'homepageLink': 'https://example.com/home' }

endpoints.description: Retrieve the link to the dashboard
endpoints.request_body: No request body is required for this endpoint. It only needs the GET method and the path /api/dashboard to retrieve the link to the dashboard.
endpoints.response: The response will be a JSON object containing the link to the dashboard, for example: {"link": "/dashboard"}

endpoints.description: Retrieve the link to the previous page
endpoints.request_body: None. This endpoint does not require any parameters or request body.

response.description: Returns a JSON object containing the link to the previous page.

endpoints.description: Retrieve the link to the contact or support page
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or request body required

data.contact_link: string, URL to the contact or support page

endpoints.description: Allow users to report issues or request help

request_body.description: string (required, detailed description of the issue)
request_body.user_id: integer (optional, ID of the user reporting the issue)
request_body.page_url: string (optional, URL of the page where the issue occurred)

response.issue_id: integer (unique ID of the reported issue)
response.status: string (initial status of the issue, e.g., 'open', 'pending', 'resolved')
response.message: string (success or error message)

endpoints.description: Log the error on the server-side for further investigation and debugging

request_body.error_code: string, unique error code or identifier

response.error_id: integer, unique identifier for the logged error
response.message: string, success message

endpoints.description: Retrieve error details including a unique error code or identifier

response.error_id: integer, unique identifier for the error
response.error_code: string, unique error code or identifier
response.reported: boolean, whether the issue has been reported

endpoints.description: Send a report of the issue to the system administrators

request_body.description: string, detailed description of the issue
request_body.steps_to_reproduce: string, steps to reproduce the issue

response.message: string, success message
response.reported: boolean, whether the issue has been reported
